snippet: Mark Buehrle escaped injury from a line drive back to the mound on Tuesday, but the Blue Jays’ J. A. Happ, who will face the Yankees on Thursday, was not so lucky in May.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column on Toronto Blue Jays pitcher J A Happ, preparing for upcoming game against New York Yankees; says Happ lived every pitcher's nightmare on May 7 when he was struck just below left ear by line drive; notes impact fractured his skull and fall on mound sprained ligaments in right knee, keeping him off major league mound for three months.
lead_paragraph: Mark Buehrle escaped injury from a line drive back to the mound on Tuesday, but the Blue Jays’ J. A. Happ, who will face the Yankees on Thursday, was not so lucky in May.

headline.main: Facing Risks That Cause Nightmares and Worse
